newsitem.title: JAPAN: Hitachi develops system to improve power output.
newsitem.headline: Hitachi develops system to improve power output.

text.p: Hitachi Ltd said on Friday it had developed a system which enhances the output of LNG-fired (liquefied natural gas) power plants during the summer, when Japan's electricity demand rises.
Output at LNG power plants tends to fall with a rise in temperatures because of their technological design.
This has meant a decline in electricity generated at these facilities in the summer when electricity demand usually peaks.
Hitachi's new system applies electricity at night -- when power demand falls -- to make and preserve ice, which is then used to cool gas turbines and improve power output.
The leading electronics firm said in a statement that the system improves power generation capability by 15 percent.
